text: Bottle 75cl. No head. Almost clear orange grain color. Aroma is rose leaves, wood, rose wine, strawberries, vine gums. Taste is sour

BOTTLE. Pours a dark gold with zero head, oily top.. Has that funky lambic aroma, with some cork, woody notes, changes with warmth.. Flat mouth feel(as stated) buttery worry notes, some butterscotch, just heapsxgoing on.. Soruced RW, cape cellars

2012 Vintage, bottled August 2015. 

Tart aroma. Wet hay, funk and fruits. Little citrus too. 

Pours a golden orange morning urine colored body with little to no head. 

The taste is tart and bitter with notes of fruits. Some vinegar as well. Fruity sweet finish. 

Medium body, Watery to oily mouthfeel, little to no carbonation.
UPDATED: MAY 31, 2017 Bardzo fajny i złożony smak, dużo skóry, stajni, ziemistości i świetnie wkomponowane wszelkiego rodzaju owoce.

04/17 @home - 75cl bottle from the brewery.
Clear golden, no head. Nose is acidic, green apple. Taste is sour, wood, green apple, some grape flavor. Very resembling to wine, but better.
Clear dark golden/ochre liquid, no head. Aroma of oak, fruity. Medium body, no carbonation. Taste is sour, with hints of oak and fruits, and an unidentifiable finish.
2014 bottle. Aroma of vinegar, sour vinous, oaky, grapes. Clear golden with no head. Taste is sour, dry and light brett. Medium body, dry oily feel, sour oaky vinous finish.
Bottle - Flowery buttery notes. Clear gold with almost no head. Bright and almost bitter herbal notes with a long acidic finish. Very herbal.
Bottle. Pours orange golden with minimal white head. Aroma is haygreen apple and barnyard. Taste is still funk, green apples, grape tannins, dust.

Bottle. Pours a lightly hazy orange with no head. Aroma is of citrus, grapes, pear, apple, butterscotch. Taste is of grapes, apple, pear, funky, citrus, tannic, butterscotch, lightly acidic. Oily mouthfeel, no carbonation.

Wytrawne, ziołowe, mokra skóra, zagroda, lekki funk, lekko do umiarkowanie agrestowe. lekka do umiarkowanej goryczka - długo utrzymująca się. Umiarkowanie kwaśne, ściągające, agrest, cytryna i grejfrut. Fajne klasyczne, ziołowe z wyraźnie zaznaczoną goryczką.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy goldenalmost no head. Aroma: apple peals, weak cow shit, oak, vinegar, white vine notes. Taste: at first sweetish and then coming sourness and acidity, berries, white vine vinegar, raw apples, hay, sulphur burning tongue. That lambic plays in your mouth. Nice. Sour finish.

Consumed for Drink It Now day, hosted by GenDV138. Poured a hazy, orange color with a small white head. Aroma was light funky, floral notes. Lots of flowers, light acid. Lemon juice notes. Pretty dry. Not as delicate as I expected it to be.

750 ml bottle shared for Allagashs Drink It Now Day. 2010 vintage. Clear golden orange color. Aromas of oak, funk, floral notes. Tastes of tart acidic notes, oak, lemon citrus. Medium body with a dry finish. Fantastic.

75cl botle shared.
Thin white head. Hazy golden pour. Sour aftertaste. Very good
Aroma and taste doesnt last that long and they texture is a bit watery. Clear and pale without much foam. Medium sourness. Soft carbonation and a bit watery texture. Good but not impressive.
0.75l fles gedeeld met lion. Amber zonder een noemenswaardige kraag. zuur en ziltig met een apel maar ook aardbei, heel subtiel maar wel vol.

Hazy golden without head. Aroma is red berries, sour stuff, oregano, cucumber. Taste is just sour berries and some raspberry pip (maybe ash) bitterness, some fusels in the back and syrupy and chalky at the same time. Not exactly easy to drink and no carbonation. Not bad.

Version from 2002
7-4-5-3-11: Much darker. Aroma is much more wood and phenols, some more smoke. Taste is so much more bitter and more ash. Almost undrinkable. Phew.

Version from 1984:
8-4-7-3-15 Clear and even darker. Smooth berries and no hints of ash and smoke. Actually this is just the smooth version of the first one.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Grand Cru Bruocsella Lambic Bio (2016) by Brasserie Cantillon at Osiedle SaskaAromat skorzano piwniczno owocowy, w uscie plaskosc cierpkosc ziemistosc winigrona jablka kwadkowate. Dziwny kontrast, niemojeOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle, from brewery. Pours orange, juice-like, no head. Aroma is sour with plenty of barnyard. Taste is a strong barnyard, not much acidity or sour. Slight bile, more barnyard. Light, no carbonation.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Z każdą kolejną butelką lubię je coraz bardziej. Minimalne wysycenie to kwestia do której trzeba się przyzwyczaić. Skórzaste bretty fantastyczne.

Aroma: barnyard, fruity, apple, some grain notes, some drugstore notes
Taste: medium sour, pip, spicy, fruity, barnyard

Aromat jest średnio-intensywny, budowany przede wszystkim przez przyjemne "suche" nuty dzikie: siano, drewno; ale w tle wyczuć można zapachy owocowe. 
Piwo jest prawie w ogóle nie wysycone, co sprawia, że w ustach jest gładkie i niemal oleiste. Umiarkowanie kwaśne, owocowe (cytrusy, jabłka) z wyraźnymi, ale nie dominującymi dzikusami.
Bottle at WTWBA. Clear golden pour. Funky lemon aroma. Taste is great, no carb, funky citrus white wine. Best unblended Ive had.

Clear golden yellow beer with no head at all. Aroma has oak barrel, sour notes. Taste has sour green apples, some yeast and oak barrel flavour. Medium body and flat carbonation. A bit weird lambic thats missing the sour punch. Oak maybe mellowed this slightly. Or I dont feel anything anymore.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Golden. Foamless. Oak barrel aroma reminds of whiskey. Plain lambic palette, no fizz alright. Honey. Light sour. Basement things. Somehow plain... Good oak!

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Clear appearance, like apple juice. Extremely bubbly head. Aroma is funk, hay, and an orchard. Taste has some fresh apples, a bit of wine vinegar, and a somewhat dry and tart finish.

Bottle shared with friends in KL. Poured a light hazy golden colour with no head. The aroma is dry fresh fruits, yeast. The flavour is moderate sour with a smooth dry fruity woof palate. Medium to light bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle, four years before bbd. Pours clear dark yellow, with a very small creamy head. Aroma is hay, lemon, fruity bretty notes and wooden barrels. Light body, with almost no carbonation. Flavour is sour, with hay, citrus peel, fruity bretty notes, farmhouse and wooden barrels. Dry finish with bretty notes.

Slightly hazy golden color, just a ring on foam on the edge of the glass. Aroma is somehow vegetal and cheesy, funky barnyard notes, quite different from other lambics. Taste is quite balanced. Some earthy funk and bitterness, tart fruits, some yeast funk on the finish. Medium body, almost flat. Really interesting lambic, very easy to drink.

6 onces on tap at Dieu du Ciel Zwanze. Aroma: blue cheese, light cherries, light citrus. App: clear golden, no head. Taste and palate: light body, light sweetness, light carbonation, some citrus in mouth, moderate high dry acidity finish. Overall: well that nose is quite something. This is meant for blue cheese lovers. I did enjoy the mouthfeel quite a lot. I like the dryness, the puckering acidity and also the citrus flavour. Good.
On tap. Orange with no head. Fruity sour aroma, wooden notes. Sour flavour, grape, pepper, very dry finish

Orange colour, no head. No carbonation- flat. Plenty of citrus- lemon, orange, bit pomelo notes, green aples and some oak. There is also plenty of hay, hint of wet leather, some vinous character, bit of acetic notes, mildly sour. No carbonation, smooth, slick texture. Very nice, beverage, without sharp edges.

On TAP at In de Wildeman, Amsterdam. Pours hazy dark orange with almost no head. Flavor: slightly tart, barnyard with sweet note, supported with peppers, citruses, spices in first half and with gentle bitterness on second one. finish is dry, slightly tart, body is light to medium, carbonation medium, texture soft.

Bottle purchased at cantillon in Brussels 
Pours bright pale orange with a soapy small white head and some vigorous carbonation. Nose is musty lots of funk and earthy barnyard character. Flavors are tart lots of barnyard and musty notes. Very true lambic for sure. Very nice brew for this style. The wood aging really shines on this one.

Draught at In de Wildeman, Amsterdam. Somewhat hazy dark orange with almost no head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Good sourness with subtle sweet and bitterness. Barnyard, tart, pepper, citrus, green apples and spices. Very good.

Bottle at home, 2012 version. No head, very flat, orange pink in the color. Taske is quite funky, lemonade but with a metallic after note. A lot of oak in the after taste. Very rounded, a very drinkabel.

750 mL bottle. Bottled April 30, 2010. Originally reviewed 10/31/2012.

Pours with a few big bubbles, but otherwise flat. Slightly hazy orange body.

Nose is orange citrus. Acidic and a little musty. Very oaky.

Fairly straightforward flavor. Lemony. A little bit of hay. No real funk or pepper to it. Simple, but pleasant. Sharp oaky lactic bite in the finish. An acidity lingers in the periphery, but doesnt become prominent until the very back end. 

Flat, but its still nice to drink, which surprises me. Light enough body to handle the lack of carbonation. 

Its tasty, but simple. I havent had many other straight lambics that I can compare, though, so I still think its good.
05-05-16 // sample at Cantillon Quintessence 2015. Vintage 2013. No carbonation, very sour. Vineous notes, Grape grassy notes.
il punto d incontro tra la birra ed il vino,piatto,secco,dalle mille sfaccettature che virano da sentori animali a note tipiche di sauvignon

Bottle 0,75L. Thanks to Kita for sharing. Pours slightly hazy, light amber-orange color with almost no head and no visible carbonation. Aroma is vinous, acetic, citric, green apples, herbal and funky. Taste is sour and vinous with hints of citruses and grapes. Light to medium body with flat carbonation. Interesting experience...

Bottle, 0.75l, courtesy of Bongtribe, shared with CanCrusher. Hazy brown amber color with almost no head and carbonation. Aroma is vinous, citric, funky, herbal and woody. Tastes of refreshing citrus, green apples, grapes and honey. Light to medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation in palate. Its totally flat, smooth and mild funky, just like it has to be...
Pours a clear light gold color. Cheese white wine grape. Medium sourness little to no carb.

750ml bottle from BottleJockey. Bottled January 25, 2016. Tasting at Brians. Pours a hazy golden with no head. Almost no carbonation. Aroma is funky, fruity, floral. Sour taste has the same notes plus some notes of hops and ascorbic. Interesting.

0,75 @ bottleshare - Sour aroma, juicy stonefruit, minerals, white wine and grapeskins. The flavor is not very sour, but has some green apple and tealeaves. Slight vanilla in the aftertaste. The beer is very subtle and should be treated more like wine than beer.

A 750ml corked and capped bottle bottled on 21st August 2015 and poured into a wine glass. It poured a very slightly cloudy golden orange colour with pretty much no head at all and very sparse lacing if any. Aromas of leather, oak, malt vinegar, dusty, chalk and funky. Maybe a hint of apricot but not really. Taste tart, sour, green apple, vinegar, lemon juice, oak and funk. Medium to light bodied with pretty much no carbonation. Overall the taste was decent and better than the aroma. However with every sip, the aroma kind of gets to me. The dusty and chalky element just wasnt my cup of tea. In addition, the complete lack of carbonation was not so good. Perhaps this particular beer is just not for me considering all the other world class Lambics that Ive tried.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 reddish to brownish golden, no head, deep funky citric aroma with fruits and wood, taste is very funky citric, high sourness, funky dry finish with lactic notes, no carbonation [Lambic Bio 2012, Bottled 25.1.2016]

750 ml bottle poured into a Cantillon tumbler. The beer is a hazed gold with a white head of foam that starts small and dissipates pretty quickly . The aroma is funky, earthy, a bit cheesy, musty, dry grassy notes, mild acidity. As it warms, more acidity comes out and more fruity acidity also comes out. Medium body and medium carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 Pours hazy honey orange copper with no head. Aroma; Barnyard, almond, citrus, oak, hay, funk, green apples and minerals. LTaste; Low carbonated, tart, green apples, almond, lemon, green tea, minerals and vinegar with a dry finish.

Bottle at Monks Cafe. Pours flat and gently clouded honey-gold. White vinegar leads in the aroma, but is tempered nicely by pronounced wine character, huge minerality (like wet cement) plus delicate green grapes, almond, vanillin, pear. Smooth and sweet. In the flavor, big tannic Brett funk tugs on the tongue and lingers long after the sip. Sugary pear up front morphs into dry white wine and a flash of white vinegar midpalate. Watery body slides the acid down the palate, depositing peppery bitterness. I know the style doesnt really call for it, but some carbonation would be appreciated.
Hazy light brown and orange in color. Very little carbonation. Dry and tart.

Lambic bio 2012
Aroma: funk, green apples, dried banana, vanilla, 
Taste: vanilla, green apple, green tealeaf.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Interessante birra. Acida un po aggressiva e astringente ma comunque aromatica con sentori che rimandano alle pesche, al pompelmo. La carbonatazione é volutamente assente, la birra é secca, senza alcun zucchero residuo e risulta piacevole e di buona beva.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Pours headless with a very clear gold body. Nose of acidic and sweaty bum. Flavour is sour, lemony, and very vaginal. Great stuff.

Bottle
Aroma-acid, barnyard
Appearance-orange, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-heavily sour, medium sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

One man down tasting. Thx Hallinghansen. Pours hazy copper with no head. Aroma of funk, barn, light green apples, light vinegar, light acetone, sour. Taste is sour, funky, barn, gooseberrie, vingar notes, light acetone. Enjoyable and very nice unblended!

Pours clear orange, transparent and looking nice as a sour beer. Nose has some acid, funk and a bit of horse blanket, next to some rotten leaves. Taste is sour, prickly acidic bitterness and then also fruits, apple peels and pears without sweetness. Long lingering dry fruity horseblanket at the end. Real good stuff but something is still missing, no idea what.

Jan 2016 bottling. Pours dark yellow with no head. Aroma: wild aroma of bretts, citrus, some marzipan in the background, almond. Taste: sourness dominates, followed by citrus and orange coupled with some bacterial-brett taste, pretty tart-dry and bitter in the finish, with the sourness burning a little in the palate.

Bottle. November 2015 bottling, from Migs World Wines, Brussels. Opened as small tribute to the people of Brussels, on a very sad day. Pours clear, dark orange. No head. Nose has mouldy lemon. Baked dessert apple. Old oak. Notes of cherry and almond. Damp, fusty cellar runs through all of that. Taste has a light, vinous, cider apple tart sourness. Turns dry and dusty. Palate is light, and clean, with a soft acidity. Finishes dry, lightly sour and vinegary, with a hint of the almond sweetness keeping things balanced.

Bottle shared, thanks Jon. Pretty much flat which reminded me of the bottle pours at the Cantillon taproom. Gives it a sour wine character with lemon, apple and honey notes. Good stuff but a bit heavy without carbonation.

1,5 liter magnum. Hazy, dark yellow colour. Vinegar, apples, white wine in the aroma. Sour, white wine like beginning. Vinegar, grass in the middle. Bit woody sour finish. Low carbonated, rather light bodied, impressive and complex lambic.

2012 bottle. From notes a couple months ago. Aroma is dominated oak with just some light flowers. Tastes like huge oak and cedar. Mild flowers. Very dry finish. Moderately sour. Interesting but not great. Too much wood.

From notes (June 2015). Trade from Alex -- thanks a ton! The fact that this is unblended, three year old lambic comes through straight away. This baby is TART. High carbonation quickly overwhelms any tiny head that formed from pouring. Sour and grape notes dominate, with some light malt toastiness. Not overly complex -- really just an exercise in sour -- but still refreshing on a summer day.

750 ml bottle shared with friends at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Light hazy golden orange color with small off white head that quickly disappears. Aroma is light funky, yeasty, wood, grapes, barnyard notes, some citrusy fruity notes. Sweet and acidic taste. Light to medium oily body with flat carbonation.

2011 Vintage poured into taster showing translucent well filtered with absolutely no carbonation. (Is my bottle off?!)

The nose shows bretty barnyard funk with hints of harmonious honey 

The palate is full bodied with no carbonation (completely still). Moderately tart and quite acetic with hints of dry apricot.

Bottle shared at Ratebeer Tokyo W & CB Tasting. Thanks Jon! 2011 vintage aged 5 years. Gold color with no head or carbonation visible. Lots of cobwebs, musty basement aromas with some oak, green apple and yellow pear as it warms. Really almost flat carbonation on the palate. Good tartness with a dry finish with more cobwebs and oak. Wished this had more carbonation though.
Flat, golden amber color. Cobwebs, sour, hay, lemon in the nose. Completely flat, lots of cobwebs, lemon, dusty and hay. Linger sour finish. Lacks a bit due to lack of carbonation.

Bottle at home shared with The Beast, 6th February 16. Pours amber, no carbonation. Aroma is funk, sour, apple, honey, candied pineapple, damp cellar wet wood. Taste is tart, hops, damp cellar, oak, rich slick mouth feel, amazing for the ABV, loved the lack of carbonation, easy to drink enjoyed every mouth full
75cl bottle. Organic version. Light hazy orange color. No head. Medium sourness. Light sweetness. Aroma is pinneapple, mushrooms, wood, citric, wheat, barnyard, herbs.
Bottle. Pour is murky golden yellow with basically no head. Flavor and aroma of oak, yeast, sour grapes, and lemon zest. Finish is lemon, sour grapes, and oak. Very funky and sour.

Nicht immer grenzt ein Lambic an Perfektion. Dieses hier nämlich offenbart schon ein paar gute Seiten, vor allem wenn es an die Frische und Fruchtigkeit geht. Zudem herrscht eine gewisse Balance am Gaumen mit einem trockenen Abschluss, der nur leicht von Essig bestimmt wird. Leider bietet dieser Lambic NULL Perlung, was die ganze Geschichte echt flau und langweilig macht. Ich hab das Produkt zwar gemocht, aber irgendwie wurde so alles laff.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a hazy light brown colour with no carbonation. Aroma of acid and dust. Taste of acid, citric, mild vinegar, unripe nuts, dust, plaster and unripe berries. Sour finish. A small amount of carbonation would have done good to the beer.

Bottle shared @ Le Bloempot, Lille - FR, during Cantillon food pairing event - Color: hazy dark golden blond beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: fruity sourness, dry acidity. Candied fruits. Perfect lambic nose. Taste: nice dry acidiy and sourness fruity and candied fruits with grassy notes. Very nice, superb attenuation. Aftertaste: good astringent and dry finish.

1/12/16 750ml bottle Old Notes-Pours golden with no head and an aroma of tartness and funk. Taste of the same with some wood and tartness on the back end. This light bodied brew is another tasty brew from these guys.
Bottle. Golden flat with no head. Earthy aroma, sharp lemon, funk and yeast. Taste is funky, sharp lemon and earthy. Flat, acidic, tart
(bottle) clear, bright orange amber with a small white head; aroma of funk, leather, sourness, fruit; rich, lightly medium sour flavour with a lonh, medium sour and light bitter finish
From notes on 9/10/15. Easily the sweetest beer we had at Cantillon. Reminded me more of a wine than a beer.

Pours an almost clear light yellow golden color with very little, but fizzy white head. Funk, tartness, sour notes actually come through on the nose on this one, with just very little light fruit; follows onto the palate. A lip puckeringly sour beer. Medium bodied. Finishes tart and dry.

(750ml 2012 label bottle @ the brewery, Nov 17 2015, split w/ phyllomedusa) Pours lightly hazy medium gold with no head. Aroma of damp attic, wet hay, woody, apple. Palate is light acidic white wine, lemon, old barn board, a bit of crab apple, background of dried hay and a bit of tannin. Medium bodied with a totally flat palate, maybe just a hint of tingling effervescence. Fairly woody as youd expect for 3 years in wood, but with a bit of fruit lingering. It never quite took off for me, just missing that element to make it pop. Glad to have tried, and it might well improve lots with age, but at the moment its not my fave Cantillon.
Borefts 2014. This makes the hair on my nipples rise. Deep wood, dry spiciness, flowery, hint of dried fruits. P-r-e-t-t-y sour. Backlog from 2014/09/26.
Poured from 22oz bottle. Pours hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is tart fruits and horse blanket funk. Silky mouthfeel. Flavor is tart fruits. Some lemon, and finishes with funk.
75cl bottle, tasting @ Chez Alain, Rennes. Yellowish and nearly completely flat, like a "vin jaune". Tart and funk, but with a relatively low sourness. Interesting, maybe even more for wine amateurs.

750ml, 2015, at the side project cellar. Dirty darker yellow. Lots of funk. Wet blanket, band aid. Somewhat metallic. Back end sour. Uncarbonated yet lively back end. These plain Cantillons need some time to pucker up. The funk without the sour doesnt work for me

Äppelmustfärg, lite grumlig, doft av gröna äpplen, kompost, tänker på lite blommor också, man känner syrligheten redan i doften, smak: en avmattad dammig smak, äppelvinäger, matt syra, syran är långt ifrån utpräglad som i geuze eller i många andra suröl, Även en slags lagrad ciderkaraktär infinner sig, lagrade på ekfats känsla, en lång äppelstjärnebitterhet infinner sig i eftersmaken

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of barnyard, earthy, citrus, lemon zest with a bit of astringency. This is very tasty and easy drinking, quite complex, with light oak notes.

This is it! Had at brewery by mold old flat and have had in bottle. 100 percent to style. Flat tingling mouthfeel without the fizz, especially out of a wooden barrel. Green apple tart with oak slight phenolic and sour dough bread. If you dont rate this a 4 or better you just dont like this style.

Bottle at Monks during a Cantillon event. April 2015 vintage. Hazy yellow gold pour with just the ghost of a ring around the edge. Low carbonation. Flavors are subtle but very complex. Notes of nectarine. Beeswax. Elderflower. Chamomile. Bruised lemon zest. Heart of palm. Honeycomb. Lemongrass. Deliciously tart. A fantastic slow sipper!

Bottle @ Zwanze, Bagby Beer Company, courtesy of richiesd! Cloudy golden color. No head. Aromas: old, wet wood, light funky, sour. Retronasal theres more sour, old, wood, funky. Flavor is moderate to full sour, woody. Light bodied. Long finish, dry, no new flavors.

Cask at the Kings Arms, London. 2011 vintage. Light amber shade with zero head. Notes of oak and waxy orange fruit rind. Quite juicy, almost chewy texture on the tongue. Sourness sticks to the gums. Completely flat. Im not a huge fan of unblended old lambic but this is nice enough and shows a bit of complexity.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2016 Oct 2015 - Cask at the Kings Arms. I think this is my first cask lambic.  Apparently 4 years old.  Clear dark orange, still, no real head. Aroma is apples, malt vinegar, leaves. Body is medium, no real carbonation, smooth. Taste is apples, apple cider vinegar, a touch woody, butter, spice. Not harsh at all. Almost like a cider. Pretty nice, but slow drinking. (3.7)
Jan 2016 - Bottle share at Chrisos, thanks to Dave.  2012 vintage, 5%.  Apple, grape, fruity nose.  Body is smooth, soft carbonation.  Taste is apple, sour, stewed fruits.  Nice.  (3.7)

Bottle poured into a small tumbler at Dolphins Higobashi 2015 Zwanze Day Event. Bruocscella 1996 was a dense cloudy orange gold with a soft aroma & body. The taste is great, mild lemon cake tartness, funk and spice. Super mellow and drinkable. I wish I couldve gotten more this was great.

Bottle poured at Novare Res, murky gold color with no head at all. Aroma is rotten lemons, dusty yeast (horse blanket), oak. 
Well, if you love sour lambic so this should be "your jam". For me its so sharp it is nearly to much. Mouthfeel is very tart and sour with a huge dry sour oak finish. Pretty intense.
Golden pour. White grape, green apple, lemon, tart, slightly lactic sourness in the aroma and taste. Dry finish and low carbonation.
Bottle at Zwanze Day Zurich, 2005 vintage. Good cat food aroma, some grapes. Nice sourness and a smooth tartness, impressive palate.
Poured from bottle at Novare Res light brown gold with minimal head. Aromas of tart funk with sour fruit and sour wheat. Taste follows aroma. A decent beer.

Bottle pour at Novare. Brown gold with no head. Aroma has a balance of yogurt and barnyard funk, sour wheat, red fruits. Nice and soft on the palate up front, then the tart cherry yogurt, barnyard funk tastiness takes over. Finish is super dry raspberry/blackberry. Flat.
Bottle at Holy Grale. Hazy deep golden with very small white head. Aroma is nice tart, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is tart and some earthy.

Bottle, fresh 2015 bottle. Almost clear golden color, no head. Aroma is barnyard, leather, grapes, gooseberry, dry white wine. Taste is medium sour, dry, light tart with some sweet notes. Flavor of lemon, grapes, funk, light vinegar. Aftertaste is dry and light tart, flavor of bitter grapefruit and lemon. Light body, watery texture, flat carbonation. Not best Cantillon unblended lambic, but very nice and complex.
Love this brewery love this style, no head slight fizz, sour Granny Smith apples, wine notes and usuall wonderful farmhouse character. Finished real dry with more tartness an wood.

Dégustée en compagnie dEspion. Aucune mousse à lexception de quelques grosses bulles égarées et éphémères. Ce lambic véritable et authentique est doré et fort appétissant! Vapeurs acides et vinaigrées, fruitées qui tendent sur le raisin vert et la pommette. Le liquide est mince et on goûte le lambic pour ce quil est vraiment : plutôt granuleux et fruité. Au corps très agréable, ce lambic est facile à déguster même pour les non amateurs du style!
Bottle. Aroma acetic, vinegary, some fruity notes. Taste medicinal bitter in the begining, then come woody, sour, winey notes. Sour aftertaste. Complexly good, but the begining is not very pleasant.
Love this style and brewery for sure. Green apple and sour light fruits. Light so light carbonation which made this so drinkable. Nice finish of oak and barnyard and some wet hay. Wonderful.
Bottle in Brussels. Amber body with golden hue. Lots of green apples and citrus in nose. Taste is lemon, citrus, green apples. Quite sour. Unfiltered texture. Too sour for me.
Perfect, lemon tart and oak and old woody wet pine aroma. Flavor of apricot and wet lumber. Funky flavor aired through the nose and dry finish.

Bottle. I think from Gramity. Thanks!

A: Clear gold color with a thin dash of bubbles around the edges. Some lacing.

N: Hearty wood/oak, funk, attic spaces, lemon and grapefruit rind, some green apple, peppercorn, base of cracker, horse blanket and stables.

T: Nicely tart, lightly sweet underneath. Not in the slightest acidic.

M: Very light body, just a touch of carbonation (I knew going in this was supposed to be still or near to it), no alcohol.

O: An interesting unblended lambic. It doesnt feel like you can get any closer to the real thing while still having it out of a bottle. That said, I mean, the lazy carbonation either gets you or it doesnt. Me, I think this is decent, but no Gueuze.

Bottle at home. Pours clear Gold with no head. Its tart, lemony, funky and flat. It doesnt have the degree of complexity that I love in a Geueze though. I really enjoyed the unblended lambics in Belgium but I failed to draw the same enjoyment here. Nice but not the same wow-factor that I associate with Cantillon.

@Cantillon from the barrel at room temperature. Clear light golden colour with almost no head. Sour, woody and basement aroma. Almost no carbonation and light body. Taste is sour with fruity and wood notes. Some dryness and fruitiness towards the finish. Overall, another level of experience for the senses.

Delt 0,75 l flaske. 2007-årgang. Døsig rødgyllen kropp med noen hvite bobler langs kanten. Aceton, gjærede bær, trefat og chutney-syrlige gojibær i nesa. Flat, medium fylde. Grapefrukt syrlig i munnen.

Cest toujours un grand moment pour moi quand jai la chance de goûter à une nouvelle bière sûre de qualité! On ma cependant fait quelques avertissements à propos de ce lambic quest la Bruocsella : beaucoup de monde le trouvent un peu étrange, le trouvent trop flat comparé à des gueuzes. Voyons voir ça... Au nez, on reconnait la complexité des lambics belges non fruités : cest comme je les aime, chargée dune complexité annonçant une expérience gustative intéressante! En bouche : cest effectivement très flat, encore plus que je ne laurais imaginé. Si ce nétait des saveurs, on jurerait un jus de pomme. Cela dit, il y a hereusement bel et bien des saveurs! Je perçois une amertûme relativement prononcée. Cette dernière se mélange au côté sûre qui mène le bal. Le côté sauvage, de cave et de cuir, est présent mais un peu léger. Je ne déteste pas, et cest une bière que je suis content davoir eu la chance de boire, mais je préfère de loin les gueuzes régulières de Cantillon. Peut-être la bouteille était-elle un peu trop jeune (2014)?

Bottle from teh brewery. Pours an orangey golden, clear with no head whatsoever. Aroma is slightly cellary with ehavy grape notes - wine aroma actually. The taste naturally follows. Soury grapes, almost completely like white wine, except for the finish - bitetry feel of a beer, but hardly noticeable. It really is the missing link between wine and beer, like promised. Not my favourite though.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2015 Grand Cru Bruocsella 14 vintage

Pours an urine yellow color with no head at all, leaving the spotlight on the actual beautiful saturated, sun-yellow color. Developes a small film of lacing at the edge of the glass.

Has aromas of glue, old oak, leather and matured hops, bound together by ripe lemon. The beers tartness gets gently balanced by the dusty oak, together with funky tartness. The nose is actually quite simple, not one-dimensional, but straight-up convincing. 

Has a soft, very refreshing mouthfeel to it, based on the beers low carbonation. Opens up the palate to the brews pleasant tartness, with no distraction at all. Needs a moment of adjustment, then becomes a revelation.

Tastes of old hops among tart lemon, old wood and an incredibly well pronounced funkiness. Its tartness gets showcased perfectly, due to he very low carbonation. Reveals an almost fruity tartness during the finish, featuring crisp lemon and green apple peel, still balanced by the wood.

Its funkiness gets perfectly pronounced by the beers very low carbonation, while the oak lends enough character to prevent it from being boring. When I have had this the last time, it was younger and even lower carbonated, while this is by comparison almost sparkling, very refreshing. Its wooden dust qualities add perfectly well up to the rich tartness, revealing an incredibly funky beer.

Bought at the brewery, bottled in 2011, 2008 organic vintage: so I had the uncarbonated lambic at the brewery and this doesnt have that beautiful clarity of character. Its so damned sour, I can tasty diary cork in it too. Some cheese rind in there. It smells like a corked wine, plenty of oxidation. It has plenty of limeade character. Not the best thing Ive had from them.

Bottle shared by JBPortland ! Pours a deep golden almost copper color with a thin ring of rising bubbles. Aromas of beeswax, leather, forest mushrooms, dry moss, orange zest and wet wood. Palate follows the nose with great contrast of musty old compost and light stonefruit nuances. Creamy mouthfeel provides a great backbone for the acidity.
Perfect blend of wood acidic citrus oak vinegar Brett lacto sour light fruits of white wine grapes and stone fruit. No head green apple taste and big dry finish.
@ Agards väg 29/5. Bottle from Cantillon. Fruity, bretty and acidic with woody notes. Body is medium, the finish is dry, fruity and bretty.
Beer tasting @ Gaultier 150529. Bottle (750 ml) from Cantillon. [ Vintage 2012 ]. Fruity and bretty with woody notes, sour and flat, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry and bretty.

2008- bottled 2012
Looks .. Amber orange, with a golden hue, no head.
Smells.. Metallic dank, musty, green apple, orange & lemon citrus .
Tastes..lemon, orange citrus, some green apple acidity, slight vinegar, very low carbonation, finishes dry with a hint of Citric bitterness.

Shared at a tasting hosted by Steebo on February 13. The 750 mL pours a hazy straw yellow color with not a whole lot of head. The aroma is pretty sour, lots of citrus sourness. There is a lot of funk also present here. Not a whole lot else going on. Maybe some apple skins, but thats about it. The flavor is no where near as sour as the aroma might insinuate. The lemon and apple skins do kind of come through here, but its not really as sour as I was hoping. The mouth feel is pretty flat and oily, not much carbonation. The aftertaste is lingeringly sour and citrusy, but no where near what I was expecting. Good, but Ive had better offerings from Cantillon
On tap at Russian River. Pours a hazy pale brown color without any head. Almost no carbonation. Mild oakiness and subtle spirit coming through.

nouveau style.
Couleur jaune légèrement trouble, aucune mousse. Nez vinaigre doux de fruits jaune, raisin avec note fruits verts. Gout vinaigre doux, raisin avec brett, fruits verts et boisé allumette assez sec. Assez complexe comme style.

Bottle 75cl, shared by Calisky. A golden beer without head, nose is intense on lactic and bretty light grapefruit touch. Aroma is very astringent, burnt plastic, wet paper, mushroom, something seem to be not normal for this lambic, sulfates, white wine, moist, wet wood.

Bottle at chriso easter tasting. Bottle thanks to the Bruce. Onion skin golden coloured pour with a lasting fine white head. Aroma is sharp light vinegar, sharp citrus, onion. Flavour is composed of tart Apple, sour granny smith Apple. Little vinegar. Palate is crisp and sharp. Avid, light acid. Moderate to low carbonation, sharp
Slightly hazy yellow orange body with no head. Aroma is sour. Taste is sour and a hint of bitter, some tart fruit. Dry woody finish.

A fresh bottle that was bottled October 6th, 2014. Pours a slightly unclear golden with no head and no lacing. Still, just like it should be. Nose is really woody, of wet wood, cheese and light damp basement. Taste is lightly tart, fruity and oaky. Lemony. Body is light, carbonation nil and mouthfeel a bit thin but nothing I cannot forgive. It is really drinkable, even more so than I remembered. I put the rest of the bottle in a carafe and will come back to it through the evening to see how it evolves. Really nice!

Pours clear golden with no head at all. The nose is mineral and tannic.. Some leathery notes a little citrus and hints of oak. The mouthfeel is where I struggle the most with this beer. Every time I try this, Im a bit let down that it has absolutely no carbonation. The taste is seriously vinous, mineral and dry which continues in the aftertaste. Not my favorite expression..
Un très beau Lambic, concentré et complexe, idéal à la fin du repas pour se remettre la bouche à zéro.
75cl. Pours hazy yellow with no head at all. Sour, woody aroma. Nice sweet and sour flavor with notes of wood and fruits. Carbonation is flat, easy to drink.
Bouteille 750ml. Couleur dorée voilée, absence de mousse. Arôme de pomme mûre, levure sauvage, terreux. Goût de pomme, levure sauvage, légère amertume. Carbonatation absente, corps moyen-faible.
On tap at Akkurat in Stockholm. Sour and fruity smell with some grapefruit. Tart taste, fruity with grapefruit. It actually has some sweetness to it. Creamy feeling. Very nice!
Golden clear color, no foam. Old feet, cheese and the typical sour stuff in the nose. No carbonation at all. Sour, funky and a bit too dry. Nice beer, Very sour, but a bit under its hype.

Clear light brown to amber, with a nice big white head. Nose is funky, sour lactobacillus, little white wine vinous, slight vinegar, brown air exposed apple flesh, musty, doughy bread. Taste is tart and sour, funky and musty, green apple, wine vinegar, white wine vinous, bread, tangy. Very nice. So good I polished off a whole bottle pretty quickly.

75cl corked and capped bottle at home, 2011 version - bottled in 2014. Transparent golden colour, no head. Nose and taste are quite complex, unlike any lambic Ive tasted yet: not too sour with barnyard, skunky tones coming through nicely, fruity lemon zest and white grapes, warming malty (?) sweetness, cask notes too. Lingering finish, with sourness building up. No carbonation, soft and dry mouthfeel, good body (especially considering 5% abv). Authentic, pure lambic.

2001 label, 2004 cork date bottle via a trade back in 2009 for some Knuckle Sandwich. Finally opened a bottle at the March Libertine Bottle Share 2015. Pours a light orange with no head, obviously. Nose is funky socks, slight sweet pear. Taste is mild sour with some more funk and raisin. Nice but this is probably better fresh.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle shared by Cuso. Golden body with no head. Aroma is sour fruits some funk. Taste is sour with some green unripe apples and hints of almonds. Aftertaste is mostly sour. Nice one.
Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 27/02/2015. Color dorado Transparente. Carbonatación plana. Acidez baja. Primera unblended.
Not too sour, pretty balanced, but on the watery side. (for 2013 edition). But then again, sours are not my preference.
Bottle split two ways. Pour is copper and completely flat. Lots of funk, cheese, mushrooms, leather, lemon juice and some grains. Solid.

February 20, 2015. Bottle at home, 2014 vintage. 
Light hazy orange with some white bubbles quickly dissipating. Aroma is funk, tart green apples, barnyard and lemon. Taste is sweet and tart apples up front, some lemon acidity and funk. Finish is light dry woody and tart, some funky notes. Smooth, flat, medium mouthfeel.

Pours a cloudy orange hue with little to no head. Smell is cherries, sour wheat. Taste is cherries up front followed by peach, nectarine, long sour notes. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Really a delicious beerz

(Cantillon Bruocsella 1900 Grand Cru) Bottle 750 ml, served into a Cantillon tumbler, ABV 5%
Golden orange colour on the body, a bit hazy, no actual head, just some bubbles forming, laving a thin line around the glass after they pop.
Nice aroma, wine notes, sour apples, some wood
Nice taste too, basically follows the aroma, quite sour but not as much as I expected, well balanced.
Tart and dry on the palate, medium thin body, low carbonation.
Tasty.

750 ml bottle shared by Cuso. Thanks!
Orange, hazy body, with no head.
Acidic aroma with funk, sour fruits, like green apples, dough, some pepper.
Sour, tart taste, with about the same aromas, also salty and overall with a very well balance.
Quite light mouthfeel, with a low carbonation.
Finishes sour, tart, salty.

Very good! Quite raw, but still with a great balance. Pretty complex of course. Overall enjoyed this a lot, but not the best Cantillon Ive had.

bottle shared by Cuso at Vienna Tasting 02/2015. Thanks Imro. orange, hazy color, almost no head. vinegarish / sour smell, cherry, funk. light to medium body, sourish, fruity, apples, very dry sour finish. not really my thing.

Yellow and hazy pour, absolutely no head. Funky toes, blue cheese /barnyard aroma. Oily on the tongue and flat. Taste follows suite, that barnyard funk, only slighty tart. Probably a good example of an unblended lambic beer. Probably not the most score shattering loon but it has its place on the sun too

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2015 Bottle. Aroma medicinal brett, light bubblegun, very light fruity, peach maybe. Hazy orange colour. Rather flat. Taste initially shocks, but mellows with second sip. Soft bretty medicinal notes, fruity, rather tart than sour. Peach. Quite good, but there are better. Rerate 2012 bottle. I am not even rating this, it would be 3 points tops. Lots of woody, tannins, medicinal. Flat. Very tart.

Bottle at Wien tasting 02/2015. My style #76. Shared by Cuso and provided by Douberd, many thanks guys. Pours bit hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma is acidic, tangerines, apples. Taste is sour, apples, tangerines, lightly sweet, some orange.

Bottle from trade with Douberd, huge thanks.  Yellow golden co,or with minimal white head, Tart aroma with lemon, basement aromas, funk. Taste, light sourness with vinegar, lemon, pepper. Light sour finish. Enjoyable, but not great.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 Bottle: Deeply hazed amber & burnt golden color, not much head (as expected) just a few mild bubbles on top. Aroma of sour lemon, sweat socks, horsey funk, wet hay, acidic stone fruit, & some faint yogurty lacto. Notes of funky cork, cheese rind, & wood near the end. Sour lemon & apple skin flavor, lightly acidic. Notes of sour lacto, hay, cork, funky driftwood, & some horse sweat. Hints of white grape & stone fruit. Cheesy, funky, woody, dry, sour. Flat, oily mouth feel. Really nice, but not in Cantillons upper echelon.
Bottle. Color is hazy yellow not much head. Aroma of funky hay and cheese. Taste is tart lemon, blue cheese faint carbonation

Bottle @ home. Pours with a bright orange colour, small diminishing frothy white head. Aroma has notes of leather, barnyard and basement aromas, very nice because its not overwhelming, as it usually happens with lambic beer. Taste is medium sweet, slightly bitter, medium sour. Medium body, watery texture, flat carbonation.

Draught @ Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Clear orange amber. Smell like piss (ok!). Restrained funk, sour, light blue cheese. Fresh, balanced, but niche.
Excellence, green apple, cherry sour cherry tart oaky goat cheese funk. Unreal balance of all the above in a wonderful example of an unblinded lambic

Bottle from Sean, bought at De Molen. Clear yellow, no head. Sharp sour nose, bitter cooking apples. Flavour is mellow sourness. Soft carbonation, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish is mellow, applejack, amazing.

Dorée à laspect embrouillé évident, aucune mousse se forme lors du versement, laissant ainsi croire que la carbonatation sera assez faible. En fait, elle est inexistante et cest tout à fait normal pour ce type de lambic. Malgré tout, une certaine rondeur est appréciable en bouche, la texture étant un peu grasse même. Lacidité est délicate et le funk est léger. Céréales et fruits jaunes samalgament dans un breuvage hautement rafraîchissant au nez poussiéreux et fermier.

Pours dark yellow and hazy. Aroma of mild funk grass and floral. Muted compared to most cantillon. Taste of oak predominance. Mildly floral citrus, grapefruit, good but blunted. Thin mouthfeel. Overall ok. Not great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(sample from bottle, Lambic Bio 2010, thanks Blade86) Light hazy, orange colour, no foam. No carbonation, watery to minimal oily texture, soft body. Aroma: Notes of brettanomyces, barnyard, basament, yeast, flowers, soft wooden aroma, wine vinegar, white fruits. Taste: High and increasing acidity, flowers and wgite,sour fruits. A bit wooden aftertaste.
December 27, 2014 - bottle shared by Brett. Clear golden pour with some bubbles as the head. Aroma and taste of barnyard funk and wood. This was very well balanced and easy to drink.

Bottle at Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Hazy golden liquid with a small white head. Aroma of lemon, white pepper, apples, bread and red berries. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemons, white pepper, apples, apple skin, funk and bread. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice.

750ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 27-12-2014.
Labeled as "Lambic Bio 2011". Bottled 6 October 2014.
Pours hazy deep golden with little vanishing white head. No lacing. Tart, grapy aromas. Light body, average carbonation, some crispy texture taht turns oily so quick. Taste is quite tart, a bit liveless, grapy, astrigent. Quite peculiar and enjoyable.

duft: æble. juice. citrus. sur.
smag. æble. citrus. hyldeblomst 
god kompleks øl

0,75 l bottle on Christmas Eve (bottled 6/10/2014). Slightly hazy, pale orange-yellow with almost no head. Only some small white bubbles that disappear quickly. Aroma of fermented apples and citrus. Sourish taste of fermented apples and citrus. Nice but not as good as expected. Medium sour aftertaste and a slightly tart finish. Thin body, fizzy mouthfeel, no carbonation. My first lambic which left me quite disappointed. I expected the aroma and taste to be more complex and intense. Still a nice beer but just too simple.

Pours slightly hazy light amber, with no head. 
Aroma has citrus, slight horse blanket, earthy, wet hay.
Taste is a tad sour, but nothing crazy.. 
average bodied, with slightly fizzy carbonation. but definitely less fizzy than the regular bio lambic.
2014 bottling had in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Wonderful nose, taste and mouthfeel. Classic vintage unblended lambic.

Vintage 2014. Doux arômes de lambics et de chêne. En bouche, le côté acidulé attaque le palais avec des saveurs de pommes fermentées. Lamertume est modéré et très fruité. Très spéciale mais un incontournable dans loffre "régulière" de Cantillon.

Bottiglia 75 cl del 2014. devo ammettere che al primo sorso mi ha spiazzato la totale mancanza di carbonazione, tuttavia una volta superato questo scalino le Cantillon fanno sempre bene il loro lavoro per gli amanti dellacido.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a thin bubbly white head, tart fruit aroma, acidic taste, tart apples, some sourness.

Sample of both 2013 and 2012 bottles at (Hopp)Kurtkeller 016: Cantillon-tastic 01 on 10/11/2014. Slightly hazy orange-amber color with a thin white head that disappears quickly to a minimal outer ring. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of tart fruit and herbs. Light-bodied with flavors of tart green apples, mildly funky yeast and mild spice. The finish is fruity with a tart apple and citrus aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

750mL bottle pours a hazy orange/golden with a minimal bubbly white head. Fruity musky aroma, oak and lambic yeast, mildly tart. Almost a restraint in the flavors, very light hesitant flavors, mildly tart, dominant oak, barnyard. Very light lambic, nothing really mouth puckering, still nice and well rounded. Might serve this as an introductory lambic. Mellow, Enjoyable.

Pours hazy amber with no head. Aroma of moldy oak, a clean tartness, sour goose berries, funky notes and some delicate floral notes. The taste is tart and dry with notes of dry wood, vinegar, funky notes, floral notes, sour goose berries and just overall very harmonic beer. Really delicate.
Sampled from a bottle at WTWBA 2014 in Minneapolis. Very cool to try this! Golden pour. Getting some apple, and plenty of funk. Fairly soft overall. Very nice.

Funky and barnyard and a good sour flavor on the hay and bready flavor. So good. Really hard to benchmark something like this, but worth it to share with some friends who love wilds and sours. Where The Wild Beers Are!

750ml bottle served in a Thumbler glass.
A: Pours an orange clear color and no head is formed. No lacings are formed or left
S: Very fruity. Strong notes of white grapes and appels. Vinegar. Notes of sweet grains, Lambic yeasts and wood
T: Surprinsing in the mouth. Slighlty sweet grains upfront. Again, very fruity with strong notes of white grapes and apples, mainly. Vinegar tartiness. Lambic yeasts, a little bit metallic. Good notes of oak and a bit of hops bitterness in the very end. An authentic Lambic but quite smooth for a Cantillon, I mean, not sour like their Kriek Lambic, for example
M: Light body. Very low carbonation. Slightly sweet and fruity aftertaste followed by mild sourness
O: Good drinkability. Not the best Cantillon Ive had but still a classic. Recommended
[ BA Review @ 1/19/2013 ]
On tap at Borefts 2014. Comes a mostly clear golden orange with no head. Aroma of fruit and funk. Taste is tart apples, funk, wood, and spice. Very good.

"unblended lambic aged three years in oak. after a couple Cantillon beers, Im just not seeing what the fuss is about, ESPECIALLY for the price! aroma is muddled lambic/sour notes, like Ive had before but watered down without the usual pleasantries. below avg. it pours flat - no head. no carbonaion provides a watery mouthfeel, and since the flavor was also watered down vegetal sour, acidic...this just isnt a good beer, for any price. sour, but not too much. cidery, but barely. this isnt delicate, its just dull. almost all lambics ive had have been better.

Bottle. Pours intense clear orange golden with no head and no carbonation. Aroma is cantillon funk, brett, barnyard, acid tart apples and some wood. Taste is pretty sour and clean. Vinegar. Watery feel due to the lack of carbonation. Dry oaky finish along with astringent tartness.

75cl bottle. Pours clear orange amber with no head at all. Aroma has lots and lots of oak. a little vanilla, and then lots of tartness, herbs, sourness and funky yeast. Taste is pretty sour. Lots of vinegar, balsamico, dry oak, bittersour funk, barnyard. No carbonation and an almost sticky boddy. Very pure!

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy and golden. 

Aroma of crisp, fresh apples. 

Very lightly carbonated, making the sourness step up so much more. 
Sour, but balanced! Nice!

At Eurhop festival in Rome-ITALY, on tap. Color is a golden/orange, a bit hazy with almost no foam. Mild refreshing sourness in the nose. Mouth has acidic pungent feel and aftertaste, very thirsty quenching. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Borefts 2014. Pours clear dark orange/amber with absolutely no head at all. Aromas of green tart apples, yeast and some stable-like notes. Taste is more sour up front, green apples, vinegar and some yeast. Some more complex underlying notes. Dry tart finish. No carbonation.
Great aroma....flavor is vague..not super tart like some from this brewery. I stilled enjoyed brew, and Ill drink again, and probably re=rate.
Tap at Borefts14: Clear amber/orange coloured with an well balanced sour taste with hints of sour apples.
Keg at the de molen festival 2014.. Amber... Thin white lacing.. Soft funky fruit nose... Soft funky fruit... Dull soft sour fruits... Light easy soft funk

Clear light brown/orange with no head. Deep wood, dry grains and spices, flowery and a hint of dried fruits. Deep sourness but balanced with a strong woody bitterness as well. Some herbal and vegetal notes. Really good!
Hazy copper with no head. Aroma is fruit, licorice andbelgian spice. Fruity palate. Aftertaste is dry, fruity, spicy, citrus and long cereal finish. Overall: excellent! Love the sweet ending.
Tap @ Zwanze 2014 Grimstad. Fairly clear orange. Aroma of grapes, wood, stables and hints of citrus and dried hay. Taste of wood, citrus and grapes. Tart and fairly dry.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2016 On tap at Erzbierschof for Zwanze Day 2014. Hazy orange color with small foam that dissipates to a ring fast. Subtler than a geuze, not as distinct. Fantastic citrus-apple taste with some hay and tartness in it. Very dry, no carbonation (as it was not blended). Really something special, as pure Lambics are not that easy to find. The missing carbonation is kinda weird, but it?s good.

Also: Vintage 2011, 2005, 1997. It always is a great pleasure.

At Zwanze 16: 2013, 2005, 1999 next to each other. 99 was a bit oxidized, but very deep and surprisingly bitter. 2005 had some cheese funk and was very oaky and nicely balanced. The "fresh" 2013 bottle was standard.

2011, 2002, 1984 next to each other at our Christmas tasting 2016, infinitely many thanks to Jonas and Joris. 2011 is quite hard to drink, cheesy, woody, lots of bitterness. 2002 is so bright and funky, lemony, with a nice tang, but also acidic. 1984 is slightly moldy, horseblankety, very woody, extremely bretty. The best one of the evening. Would not have expected this.

Bottle from Edmunds Oast. Light amber pour with essentially no head. Deep sweaty, earthy and oaky funk with notes of Granny Smith Apples and Asian pears. Flat carbonation and flavors that mimic the aroma that end on a mild citrus tartness. Super tasty.
Cant go wrong with this brewery. Sour pear and green apple aroma. Some hay and straw. A little more subdued than the Iris, but still fantastic. I love this style and this one is great

Bottle had at Kwints in Brussels, overlooking what looks to be the tower on the bottle label. 2010 sticker, March 2014 bottle date. Cool! Pours deep golden colored with no head and no real bubbles coming up. Aroma is vinous, white wine, oak, vinegar, some sugar sweetness. Flavor is honey apples, vinegar, lightly sour, funky yeast notes, a bit of buttery influence, and drinks very much like a super smooth chardonnary. No carbonation and medium bodied. This was very interesting, pretty unique, and something Id order again in place of white wine.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours hazy golden with no head. Aroma is mild, organic fruity, weak vinegar. Taste is weak apples, vinegar, almost flat carbonated, easy drinking, I would have liked some more bubbles, but still a good one, lingering woody vinegar, grows on you.

2010 label, 2013 cork date. At Poechenellelder with Taylor and Kimberly. Pours orange with pretty much zero carb. Aroma is nice smooth cantillon funk, light smooth nice. Taste is smooth light quality funk. I love it just like cantillon. A beautiful beer.

2007 (bottled 2010), with great thanks to jtclockwork - really appreciate it, man! I just received this bottle a week ago, and as it came up in conversation during a tasting i finally had that moment where I could disappear and emerge moments later with a bottle of the very beer under discussion. Anyway, thought Id comment for next time I read this -- it was a nice moment, and I wanted to open it anyway. Pours with light pear juice color; still; restrained (but unmistakeable) funk; apples are there, too. Somewhat tannic, slick, oily, medium body. Apples and pears. Again, what I imagine from Cantillon, but with everything muted. Theres a lot of tea as well, but really nice. Overall: nice, restrained, Cantillon essence. Glad to both drink this and share it.

Sans mousse, ça manque de gueule, même si sa robe est plutôt charmante dans ses tons dorés. Elle est légèrement voilée. Un nez de brettanomyces bien raisonnable, entremêlé de parfums fruités. En bouche, cest bien acidulé et sûr, alors quune finales poivrée se termine bien abruptement. Une amertume occupe larrière-goût. Quelque chose de "vieux" meuble le palais. (Embouteillée le 4 septembre 2013) (1145-190714)

Old Cantillon lambic and one of only a couple of flat lambics that are bottled in their pure, unsweetened form - ideal for those trying to get familiar with this style but unable to visit the region where it is made. Reminiscent of Cantillon Gueuze but only in a basic kind of way and obviously flat, though a very modest and very loose, embryonic head can form due to fermentation continuing in the bottle; softer too, as this is only the old, lactic lambic, but it offers all the funkiness, horseblanket, esters, sherry- and hay-like flavours one can expect in this type of beer, which is exotic even to modern-day Belgian consumers. A unique thing this is, one of so many examples of Cantillons creativity in innovating the style without even thinking of compromising it.

2014/08/05 - Pours a translucent orange/gold colour with no head. Aroma is sour apples, wood and barnyard funk. Taste is tart apples, wood, Brett funk and acidic wine notes. Moderately to highly sour and slightly drying. Medium body with almost no carbonation. Highly enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2010 bottle. Aroma of tart apple, wine, wood, earthy notes, barnyard funk. Flavour is nicely sour. Quite dry. Wonderful Lambic.

Bière sans col offrant un nez assez boisé, peu amer moyennement fruité. En bouche, la dégustation est assez sèche, pas trop acide, mais assez bien maltée sur des notes biscuitées laissant la langue rêche et développant des arômes de fruits rouge (groseille). Gueuze très bien équilibrée entre les maltes, lacidité et le boisé. Intéressante.

Bottle shred by Tom10101, thanks. Not so sure about this one. Interesting notes of acidity, fruits, woods, wine and bretts, but it seems like the sum is somehow lesser than its parts. Would like to try it again though.
Tart, green apples and strawberries in aroma. Hazy orange. Tart and sweet and pretty sour. Interesting but i prefer more carbonation.
UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 Tap at Akkurat. Pours deep amber/copper with a small head. Distinct funky. sour aroma with some citrus. Tart taste with citrus and maybe some seabuckthorn. Sour finish.

Organic version. Dry and acidic and generous notes from oak casks. Deep and vinous. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice golden color with some floaters. But no prpoblem. very sour and barnwood aroma. Very dry excellent tart green apple ,and sour mellon. Very refreshing.
08 sticker. Rusty orange, flat. Nose is funk, farmhouse, mouth-watering sour. Taste is tart lemon, funk, straw, pretty tart. Medium watery mouthfeel.

2007 bottle. Golden copper color with only a few bubbles and no head. HUGE tart, sour aroma that waters your mouth from across the room. Big bold flavor too with a little earthiness from the cork. Good but not my favorite.
Bottle thanks to mcbackus. Nose is a a tad weird for me, cheesy. Pour is flat and orange, really orange. Taste is a slightly oxidized, slightly tart, pretty light. Not my favorite.

Bottle, 75cL. Home. A sparkling golden orange beer with yellow hues. No head. No bubble. Acid aroma with smoke, wood. First sweet, then sourness expresses itself (from medium to heavy, then medium). Light body, thin watery texture, flat, light sour finish (not dry). Overall, a peculiar experience : other Cantillon beers I drank were drier and sourness was sharper. I will have to drink that one again.
Bottle thanks to mcbackus. Nose is a pungent cheesy. Pour is flat and orange. Taste is a slightly papery oxidized, slightly tart. Cork was 2008 and I think its a touch past prime.

Bottle thanks to mcbackus. 2008 cork. Clear, orange color, no head. Huge funky, barnyard, horse blanket, sweet, lightly tart, aroma. Semi sweet, horse blanket, funky, citrusy. Mouthfeel is thin and flat, indicative of style.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2014 Nose: Oak, lemon, forest, slight summer fruits; rich. Taste is deeply oak, leading to cider, white grapes, sherry, a bitter light sour finish. There is a white wine note that lingers in the finish. Mouthfeel is smooth but the absence of carbonation is strange. 

Good but surprisingly light in sour.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Yes flat.
Bottle at home. Pours golden, funky sour woody nose, taste is dry, not too sour, earthy, grapes, vinegar.

Bottle at home. 2007 edition. The colour is cloudy deep orange with no head. Aroma of horse blanket, rowan berries, lime, forest floor and oak. Has a sour flavour but less than expected, and with tones of more horse, apple cider vinegar and pepper. The mouth feel is flat and silky, and has a light bitterness. An interesting beer experience, and the beer feels surprisingly round and easy drinking for a unblended lambic.
Excellent oak smell, with white wine...orange no bubbles, really. Really nice cellar aroma and background flavor! Great unblinded lambic all around.
Orangish colour without head. Aroma has notes of light barrel, some berries and bretts. Acidic flavor with wooden notes and hints of grapes. Flat carbonation with a moderate acidic final.
Bottle from bierkoning, amsterdam. Hazy bronze color, some white bubbles on head. Aroma is very sour, apples, fruits, earth. Balanced sour and fruity taste, some earth on taste. Nice lambic.
shared bottle. poured a clear orange colour with no head. classic cantillon funky aroma. peach, grapes, acid, apricots, musty hops. vinegar, oak, low carbonated.

Pours a slightly hazy medium gold with no head despite an aggressive pour. Nose is oaky barnyard funk, white wine, apple cider vinegar. Taste is lemon, apples or pears, vinegar, woody funk. Mouth feel is medium to light and utterly flat, finishing bone dry with lingering sourness.

This takes a bit of getting used to, particularly with the utter lack of carbonation. The flavour does open up significantly the more it warms up, and the sourness builds and lingers.
1999 vintage: Pale golden coloured. Crystal clear. Acidic nose. Very tart, cask character, some salt. Complex like a fine whiskey. Very sour.

Bottle @ Akkurat. Probably one of the Cantillons I like the least but prefer to drink a lot of the most. Very easy drinking with lots of barnyard and lemon, very clean flavors and an easy-to-like sourness which makes it suitable for those that just found the world of lambic. Finishes off dry with a white whine feeling due to the light body.
Body is light amber with no head. Aroma has sweet fruits, light whiskey woody character. Taste has barrel like sweetness with light fruity sourness. Body is full, high carbonation.

Color miel limpio, sin espuma. Aromas equilibrados de brett. madera y fruta verde. Cuerpo denso, inicio dulce y afrutado al que se añade una acidez equilibrada y los toques de madera y brett. Final seco. Muy rica.
Ive never rated this one! 750ml bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with a small sized head. Funky, tart citrus, woody, fruity, and some barnyard.
At quintessence. Golden-orange colour qith no head. Fruity aroma. Fruity, sweet, malt and wood taste. Medium body.

Pours slick and viscous, in a chalice, zero bubbles save for a misplaced one here or there..Barnyard palate with hay and grass, hazy if chilled and transluceny when served at cellar temp. An easygoing, tasty pour with 2-5 years on it, though somewhat young and undeveloped fresh. Good standby to have, and interesting to hang onto in hopes that it carbs up someday. Aging shows minimal impact as there is little to no carbonation by intent, however oxidation seems to round the beer out, seems to get a bit funkier and sweetens up as it gets a bit older.

DWF; Lambic Bio 2010. Pours hazy golden orange with no head. Aroma is sour, yeast and citrus apples, lambic. Taste is acid sour and bitter, both lasting like "sour feets". Body is light to medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours orange, little clearer than 1 year old Lambic sample. Aroma is little sour, fruity. Taste is more intense sour than the 1 year old, dry and not bitter (1 year old was bitter).

Old rating rerated 17.04.2014, tap @ Akkurat Bar & Restaurant:
Tiny bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is mild fruity, mild vinegar, oak, sorrel, apple juice, apple skin, grass, caramel. Taste is slightly dry grassy, sorrel, oak, sour apples skin, mild vinegar, minerals, grass, hay, sour socks. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice and easy drinking.

Appearance: Lambic Bio 2008. Cap and cork. Yellow brown-ish, slightly hazy. Pretty flat with microscopic head.
Aroma: Sourness, fruit.
Taste: Tart fruit, white wine. Sour. Probably very good if youre into this stuff, but Im not...
Info: 750ml bottle, 20/4-2014, 58/100, BB: 16/1-2032
Bottle at 7 Eclipse Tasting. Pours a hazy orange with a tiny head. Tart and fruity. Also aromas of berries. Hints of vinegar. Medium bodied. Very soft carbonation. Dry finish with more sour berries.

Pours a medium yellow with some amber tints, minimal foam dissipating quickly. Nose is musty and earthy, wet barn floor, lemon, funky oak. The palate is dry, medium sour with flavors of oak, white wine, lemon juice, earthy must, finishing short and acetic.

Slight bubbles, thin white foam, orange hazy color lemon and more lemon aroma, pretty acidic, but I did like it. Residual yeast in bottom, not a problem, 750 bottle. I think from hi times in Costa Mesa I was told. Would have again.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2014 4/6/2014. Bottle at home (bio 2010, shared). Pours a golden orange with no head. Sour flowery/fruity aroma, citrus, wood, white wine. Same fruity tartness in the taste, citrus, white wine. Not too acidic, very nice and very drinkable.

11/7/2014. Bottle at home (bio 2011, shared). Aroma still as good as we remember, but the taste and mouthfeel are disappointing. Definitely not as 
good as the 2010 we tasted. 8/3/6/2/12

Taster at the White Horse, Parsons Green, 25th May 2011, courtesy of Scopey. Slightly hazy and bitty gold. Delicate sourness, really calmed down by the wood aging. Nice citric bite and a fresh finish. An exceptionally drinkable sour.
Bottle shared with others on a course in Leuven. Hazy lemon with no head. Aroma is sour. Flavour of tart yeast, wood, citrus with a dry tart finish.

Lambic bio 2010. Pale yellow. No head. Uncarbonated, or very close so. Aroma of funk, barnyard, hey. Lambic. Quite sour. Dry. Funk. Citrus barnyard. The mouthfeeling is wierd because its not carbonated. Soft.

Version bio 2008. Liquide dor, effervescence nulle, nez presquen vinaigre mais qui laisse percevoir des pointes de raisins et de levures sauvages. Passablement acidulée en bouche, elle est cependant assez ronde, bien piquante, dune belle profondeur. Un lambic de référence, moins facile dapproche que certains autres, mais qui impressionne par son audace et ses saveurs outrageusement franches.

Aroma: distinct sourness, lemon, hay, oak, good dose of Brett earthiness and complexity.
Appearance: golden/copper pour, no head.
Taste: lemony tartness, hints of oak, some earthy/leathery character and spiciness from the Brett.
Palate: light-medium body, no carbonation.
Overall: interesting brew - would have to say that I prefer at least a bit of carbonation, but still rather enjoyed this.

750ml bottle. Orange golden colour, no head and aroma of woody oak, sour. Taste is tart, vinegary with yeast, oak, lemon rind. Slick mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, dry souring finish. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2016 Aromat piwa był wspaniały, cuownie owocowo - winogronowy z zalewie lekko wyczuwalną nutą kwaskową i stajenną, co zwiastowało piwo umiarkowanie słodkie. Nic bardziej mylnego, w smaku dominował silny kwasek przechodzący wręcz w cierpką goryczkę wyrazistym, długim finiszem, który jakby zalepiał podniebienie i zostawiał posmak rozgryzionej pestki winogrona. Do tego gdzieś w tle nuty owocowe, kwaśne jabłko, porzeczki, agrest, takie klimaty... Mnie brak wysycenia nie przeszkadzał, zmniejszył pijalność, ale przez to dłużej rozkoszowałem się tym piwem. Doskonałe!4.6 EDIT powrót po 2 latach bolesny. Aromat nie zapowiadał kataklizmu, było w nim coś niepokojącego, ale prze wszystkim nuty dzikie, po raz pierwszy wyraźna słodowość, cośtam dziwnego ala apteka gdzieś w tle. W smaku niestety totalnie zdominowane przez ten dziwny apteczny posmak, co w połączeniu z zerowym wysyceniem sprawia wrażenie niepijalnego syropu. Nie no, okropne to było.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 Version Bio 2008. Tappad 19 januari 2012. 

Enastående doft. Välutvecklad och mogen fruktighet. Inslag av äpplen och surnat hö och där syrligheten är tydligt vinös. 

Vacker orangetonad färg, påminner om äppeljuice. Disig och helt utan kolsyra som sig bör. 

Mycket kraftig smak med rejält sura fattoner. Drar åt äppelcidervinäger och med en mineralaktig finess. Riktigt intressant med sin komplexa blandning av skarp surhet och den välutvecklade, jordiga karaktären. 

Eftersmaken är trevligt torr och behagligt avrundad med en lite spritsig syra.
No bubbles. Flat and alluring with a lemon tart under stated flavour. Opens up nicely and is an exceptional beer.

Pours a clear golden orange with poor head retention. Aroma is barnyard, earthy, goaty, ash, smoke, sulphur and funky cheese. Taste is wheat, barnyard, wood, light fruit, citrus(grapefruit) and a bit of astringent puckering on the finish. Light bodied, very dry mouth feel and a high tartness. No carbonation and a sticky mouth feel round out this fine pleasant to drink unblended lambic.

Orange-gelbe Farbe, saurer Geruch. Keine Kohlensäure. Sauer-herb, muffig-trocken. Der Hauptteil ist ganz leicht süßlich, die Holznote ist deutlich zu spüren. Der Nachgeschmack ist deutlich sauer, holzig, lang anhaltend.  Interessant --> 7/7/12/9

Uno straordinario esempio di lambic piatto, che linvecchiatura ha reso più morbido e piacevole. Bella acidità avvolgente, arricchita da note legnose e sfumature fruttate, speziate appena percettibili. Riempie la bocca e soddosfa il palato!
Bottle. Fresh, barnyard-like beer with a higher sweetness and lower acidity compared to this brewers geuze. A touch of something a bit fruity. Low bitterness. Almost still.

flat yellow gold pour
nice and sour on the nose
taste is not even that sour, though it ends dry

Bottle. Pours a clear light gold with a white head that starts at the edges and dissipates nearly completely. Aroma is full of Cantillon funk with a touch of barnyard and a light acidic tartness underlying. Flavor starts with with light tartness that grows to have a bit of acid and finishes a touch dry and funky.
Zachte lambiekgeuren, vochtig hout, kelder, stro en funky brett leiden tot een prachtig uitgebalanceerde smaak met zachte zuren.

750ml bottle, 2010 vintage. Pours a hazy burnished gold, with no carbonation or head. White peach and nectarine, nutty oak and a subtle touch of leathery sourness make up the aroma. Nectarine notes give it a little acidity up front, leading into a rounded body of white peach, cashew and smooth oak. A restrained leathery sour note makes itself felt in the finish. This is by far the most unusual beer I have tried. It has all the flavour complexity of a high quality oaked chardonnay, but blended with just a little lambic sourness. It is totally different to any beer that I have tried, yet extremely rewarding and enjoyable too.
Had at the BGoA Winter tasting. Pours a hazy golden with no head. Sour flowery aroma. Slightly sour and tart. Apricots and pears. No carbonation. Very nice.

750ml bottle from September 2007 in a tulip. Pours deep amber/copper with a small head. Aroma of funkiness, barnyard notes, some oak, light malts, light sour notes, grapes, and light spices. Flavor the same. Smooth texture but light carb. A good beer.

Bottle at Gainsbar. Orange amber, lifeless. Ultra funky, wood, sour, lightly fruity, musty. Taste is nowhere so shocking, vinous, sour, flat, wood.
Exciting, teeth coating.
This one poured a medium orange collor with no head. Aroma was of light funk, cheese, oranges and lemon peel. Falvor was mild cheese, hay, and orange notes.
Bottle thanks to beerman6686. Pours a clear golden color with no head. Aroma of barnyard funk and some citrus and stone fruit. Medium body no carb.
hazy dark golden colour. Flat, no carbonation. Very complex aroma of citrus, grasses, barnyard. Sour beer, dry and bitter finish. Very good.

vinegar, floral, fruity (grapes?), woody, maybe barnyard? aroma; golden clear, no foam (duh!); heavy sourness, slightly sweet, tartish; light body, thin but little oily feel, no carbonation (duh!), long dry and also sour (wineish) finish
Overall: great beer, very interesting, great taste, wine amongst beers
Notes from backlog. Less acidity than expected, a lot of fruit, not only citrus and lemon but also apples
Vintage 2007. Bottled 2011. Thanks Kenny for sharing! Funky barnyard aromas with sour fruity flavors. Delicious!

Bottled 0,75L. Clear yellow color with a modest foamy head and long and lively bubbly presence. Pleasant frsh and citru aroma, very crisp and lively nose. Aroma is acidulous, powerfull citric and apple mouth, notes of cider, white wine, no bubbly mouth.

2010

Pours flat, bit of haze, yellow to blond

Smell wheat and funk. Tangerine and citrus. Tart

Taste very sour, lemon peel, bit bretty in the middle, bile and lactic acid. 

No carb, light body

Very good. Unique.

Superb tasting lambic. Drunk from 75 cl bottle bought from brewery. 2007 lambic bottled in 2010.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2009 bottle pours flat, golden hue. Big funky barn yard nose. Taste follows with tartness. Mild acidic nature.

2009 bottle. Pours a clear straw color. Horse blanket, lactic acid, and heavy funk fill up the nostrils for the aroma. Slight funkiness and lemon are the dominant flavors with mellow oak. Completely still with a dry white wine finish. OK, but it falls short of the overall stellar quality of most Cantillon brews.
Had this to start a sour tasting, woah, super sour/funcky/barn. Glad i had the chance to try, would not seek out again
This lambic beer matures for over 3 years on oaken barrels. This lambic beer has a very unique and special colour and aroma. The Cantillon Grand Cru is mostly consumed in a regular wine glass.
750 ml bottle, vintage 2009. Clear golden with no head. Aroma tart, sour, sea buckthorn and vitamin c. Taste is very refreshing, tart bordering to sour, vitamin c and sea buckthorn. Nice..

As for my 1500th rating , i decided to crack this one . Might not be a whale , but this is the last cantillon i have left to tick that im able to gwet . why i chose this one ? Pure respect for tge brewer . And the team . And the products . 

Theyre awsome 

Bottle 75 cl @ home , botteled 3 years ago . So lambic now is 6 y old 

Pours fuzzy blonde , no foam as to be aspected 
Smell is pure cantillon funk 
Very dry mouthfeel , funk ( much funk ) some minor but sharp sourness that leaves instantly
Aftertaste is pure dry bitter funk . 

So basicly , if you like their typical funk - get this . If not , avoid at all cost . 
I myself love their funk , but prefer a little carbo in my beer . As for a lambic though , this does everything its ment to do . Respect , again , guys !
Bottle shared at Darkness Day. Yummy - sour, more on the acetic side, but still soft and complex.
Poured clear golden with a frothy ring. Aroma of extremely tart apples, earth and wood. Medium body, very acidic, aftertaste is dry, bitter and sour.

Bottled: 2011
A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, No Head, No Lacing

S: Sour Mash, Apricots

T: Sour Mash, Apricots

M: Poor Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Sour

Overall, too bad the carbonation was crap because the beer was good without it, but not great.

Exceptionally clean clear flavor, just exploding with balanced tart and sour with the raw funk of nature. Tons of slick malts behind it all with pils, kilned sweetness, and wheat twisted by wild yeast. Carbonation is a dream, sprite yet soft, an amazing effect and aids the flavor tons. Slick and complex. Damn, like the Brueghel painting I could drink this by the tankard on a Fall night. Can we get more unblended lambics, please? A fascinating experience as the lack of barrel blending makes a for a clear and singular flavor profile.
Siiderimäinen, samea ulkonäkö, ei vaahtoa tai kuplia. Maku aluksi miedon hapan, happamoituu jälkimakua kohden. Katkeruus selvemmin alun maussa; jälkimaussa jää taka-alalle.
Looks like gold in the glass. No head and no carbonation. Acidic and sour. Some apples and tart. Extremely good

Bottle 0.75l from Marlou Zonhoven. Pours an orange with no head and actually no carbonation. Looks like cider or aged white wine. Aroma is tart, acidic, vinegar. Taste is at first very sour and intense. After some time it gets much more balanced between vinegary sourness, apples, grapes and some bitter hints. Really like how this beer changes in the glass over time. Unique and great beer.

Golden orange in color.... Aroma of barnyard funk, acidity... Flavor is citrus acidity, grains, earth, not terribly tart but super funky... Enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,75l bottle from the 2009 vintage shared with my friend. Fruity odor with some tart feelings. Clear, deep golden color without any foam. Very beautiful in its style, esspecially the color! Fruity and deliciously sour. On the tip of the tongue I felt pure flavours of the barrel and the fruits. It reminds me to wine a little. During the swallow it reaches the back of the tongue. There comes the sour flavours. Intensive, acidulated and tart. Medium sour taste with some bitterness. Its very silky. Slick texture, medium body, no carbonation. Dry, tart but pleasant aftertaste. Very delicious and pleasant lambic. The sour flavours are moderated and it has mature fruit flavours too. Very balanced, complex and mature lambic.
750ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy gold with no head. Aroma is sour earth, cheese, ash and mint. Taste has ashy lemon to start. Mild sour ashy finish.

Very nice. Lots of bretta. No carbonation, obviously. Has a wine-like texture. Some sour guava and grapefruit citrus. Some hay. This is a pretty wild drink. Finishes with extreme sourness and a little bitterness. Pours clear orange. Bottle at Volo for Zwanze Day.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 750ml bottle shared with Trish, 2009 organic vintage. Zwanze Day 2013 at Novare Res in Portland, ME on 9/14. Pours clear golden yellow/orange with no head. Little to no carbonation. Nose is acidic, oak, tart apples, oats, hay, basement. Mouthfeel is flat and smooth, wine-like. Taste is super funk, apples, oak, medium-high tart, earthy, peach, fruit, barnyard, citrus. Finish is complex, tart, funky, sourness increases as it warms. Very enjoyable, classic Cantillon profile.

Bière orangée pâle et limpide, sans effervescence et sans mousse. Le nez est fruité, boisé et sauvage. En bouche, le produit présente une belle acidité  mi-sucrée mi-amère  avec une finale plus âcre qui laisse sa trace au palais. Sur létiquette, on décrit ce produit comme un «véritable vin de grain» et jaurais tendance à être daccord. Il existe effectivement plusieurs similitudes entre un bon vin et cette bière particulière. Un classique à essayer, ne serait-ce que pour goûter à UN lambic «pur» qui na pas été mélangé.

Poured a murky amber with zero head.
Smell of lemon peel and green apple
Tast had a moderate funk, light sourness, citrus accents. 
Mouthfeel was non carbonated which in not a huge fan of still lambic
Probably my least favorite cantillon

Three year old organic version bottle. Thanks to foofaa for the share.


A - Pours murky golden amber with no head at all leaving no lace at all.


S - Smells of a moderate amount of funk, mild basement must, some light horse blanket funk, dash of grass and a bit of lactic sourness. Probably the most mild of all the Cantillons I have tried.
